intro: Ambrosia hispida, commonly known as rough ambrosia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and rough, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert or semi-desert regions. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the spring, and the plant produces small, hairy fruits that contain tiny seeds. Ambrosia hispida is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it an important species in xerophytic ecosystems.
